entry.title: Russia Says It Controls Mariupol, but Ukrainian Troops Hold Out in Steel Plant
entry.content: Russia presented it as one of its first victories in the conflict after weeks of setbacks, though Ukrainian forces were still blockaded inside a steel plant in the city and said they were continuing to launch attacks.

entry.title: Refugees from Russia, Ukraine Mingle in Mexican Border Town
entry.content: Tijuana has become a gateway for thousands of Ukrainians and Russians fleeing the war in hopes of crossing north to begin a new life.

entry.title: He Worked for Moscow's Police for Nearly 20 Years. Then He Spoke Up About Ukraine.
entry.content: Sergei Klokov now faces 10 years in prison in one of the first known cases under a new Russian law that prohibits spreading information on the war that goes against the Kremlin line.
